availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William McNeill Clough (Platte County, Missouri, lawyer. )

body.p: Platte County, Missouri, lawyer. Boston, Suffolk County, Massachusetts, native. Son of William Clough and Mary Clough. Married to Mary Ann Scott Embry Clough in Platte County, Missouri, on May 1, 1855. Father of Mary Nancy Clough, James Clough, and Amanda R. Clough. Graduate of Harvard Law School in Cambridge, Middlesex County, Massachusetts, in 1853. Admitted to the Missouri and Kansas bars in 1854. Farmer in St. Charles, Missouri, in 1850. Lawyer in Platte County, Missouri, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Charles County, District No. 78, p. 53A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Platte County, Pettis Township, p. 639.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kansas, Leavenworth County, Leavenworth, Ward 1, p. 286A.
"The Angel of Death," The Leavenworth Evening Standard (Leavenworth, KS), January 26, 1883.
"DEATH OF WM. MC N. CLOUGH." The Leavenworth Weekly Times (Leavenworth, KS), February 1, 1883.
"William McNeill Clough (1831-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial #136371264, accessed July 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/136371264/william-mcneill-clough.
